input.skipToStart: Apply all commands reversed without animation

commands.introduction: You can control how the cube rotates using commands.
commands.parts: Every command can be divided into three parts: layer reference, layer letter, and a modification. The layer letter is the only required part.
commands.separation: Commands must be separated by spaces or commas.

help.defaultRotation: Layer letters will rotate clockwise unless modified by a
help.layerLetterGroups: Layer letters can be grouped into two categories: dynamic and fixed letters.

dynamicLetter.title: Dynamic Letters
dynamicLetter.introduction: A dynamic letter refers to a specific layer unless modified by a layer reference.

case.introduction: Dynamic letters are usually written in uppercase. Their meaning can change when written in lowercase.
case.uppercase: Uppercase dynamic letters rotate a single layer.
case.lowercase: Lowercase dynamic letters rotate the first two layers on a 3x3x3 cube, the second layer on larger cubes, and the first layer on a 2x2x2 cube.

layerReference.introduction: The rotated layer can be overwritten by a layer reference, which must always come before a dynamic letter.

categories.introduction: The layer can be defined in two ways.

wide.explanationEnd: can be added at the end to rotate the first x layers.
wide.example: Rotate the first four layers starting from

multiple.title: Multiple
multiple.example2: First and third layers starting from

fixedLetter.title: Fixed Letters
fixedLetter.introduction: A fixed letter always refers to a specific layer and cannot be modified by a layer reference.

case.introduction: Fixed letters are usually written in uppercase. Their meaning can change when written in lowercase.
case.uppercase: Uppercase fixed letters rotate the middle layer of an odd-sized cube and the two middle layers of an even-sized cube.
case.lowercase: Lowercase fixed letters rotate every layer except the two outermost layers, and the whole cube on a 2x2x2 cube.

modification.introduction: Every command can be modified by one or two optional characters that must come after the layer letter.

loops.introduction: Loops can be defined by wrapping commands in parentheses and adding the number of repetitions after the closing parenthesis. Nesting loops is also possible.
